decks.notes: The focus of this deck is to quickly assemble the combo of Greasefang and Parhelion II to generate significant value and pressure against the opponent. It includes support cards for removal, disruption, and protection to facilitate the combo. Utilizing the strengths of the two key cards, the deck aims to close out the game efficiently by overwhelming the opponent with powerful creatures and generating advantage from their synergies. The inclusion of other cards such as Bitter Triumph, Fear of Missing Out, and Bloodtithe Harvester also enhance the deck's strategy and effectiveness in executing its game plan.

This Dimir Control deck focuses on utilizing a wide array of control cards, including counterspells, hand disruption, removal spells, and card draw to control the game and outvalue the opponent. The inclusion of Yorion as a companion allows for additional card advantage and provides flexibility in the deck's strategy. The deck aims to grind out the opponent with incremental advantages while preventing them from executing their game plan effectively. The deck also includes a small reanimation package with Sheoldred and Kaito to provide additional threats and value.

The main concept of this Rakdos Aggro deck is to apply constant pressure on the opponent with aggressive creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Heartfire Hero, while using powerful burn spells like Reckless Rage and Infuriate to clear the way and finish off the opponent quickly. The inclusion of cards like Claim / Fame and Callous Sell-Sword provide versatility and additional reach when needed. The deck aims to overload the opponent's defenses and win the game before they have a chance to stabilize.

The deck is focused on creating a fast-paced aggressive strategy using a combination of creatures and spells to overwhelm the opponent. By utilizing efficient creatures like Llanowar Elves and Elvish Mystic to ramp into powerful threats like Archon of Emeria and Skyclave Apparition, the deck aims to apply pressure early and maintain board advantage. The inclusion of cards like Collected Company and Thalia, Guardian of Thraben helps to disrupt the opponent's game plan while ensuring a steady stream of threats to close out the game quickly.

This Dimir Control deck focuses on manipulating the opponent's hand and board with cards like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push, while also utilizing Narset, Parter of Veils to control the opponent's draws. In addition, the deck utilizes a variety of powerful threats like the companion Yorion, Sky Nomad and Sheoldred, the Apocalypse to close out the game. The deck also includes a mix of lands to ensure consistency in mana production. By carefully controlling the game state and disrupting the opponent's plans, this deck aims to outlast and outmaneuver its opponents.

The main idea of the deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells. By utilizing cards that provide direct damage and efficient creatures that can deal damage quickly, the goal is to put pressure on the opponent early in the game and maintain that pressure throughout. The inclusion of mana-producing lands and versatile creatures allows for flexibility in playstyle and adaptability in various situations. The deck aims to establish board presence and deal damage swiftly to secure victory before the opponent can stabilize.

This Jund aggro deck focuses on sacrificing creatures to trigger powerful effects and deal direct damage to the opponent. By combining cards like Mayhem Devil, Cauldron Familiar, and Witch's Oven, the deck can create a steady stream of damage while also gaining value from sacrificing creatures. The deck also includes removal spells like Fatal Push and Claim the Firstborn to control the board, as well as powerful threats like Kroxa, Titan of Death's Hunger and Ygra, Eater of All. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of aggression and incremental value.

This Rakdos Aggro deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells, utilizing cards like Emberheart Challenger, Monastery Swiftspear, and Heartfire Hero to deal damage efficiently. The deck also includes cards like Reckless Rage and Fatal Push for removal to maintain board control. The goal is to apply constant pressure on the opponent and finish them off swiftly before they have a chance to stabilize. The inclusion of Den of the Bugbear provides additional threats, while Monstrous Rage and Infuriate boost the power of creatures for a bigger impact.

The deck focuses on building a strong board presence with low-cost creatures and utilizing anthem effects to pump them up. It aims to overwhelm the opponent quickly with aggressive plays and efficient creature recursion. The inclusion of land cards like Mutavault and Shefet Dunes allows for additional combat tricks and buffing capabilities. By utilizing cards like Thalia's Lieutenant and Adeline, Resplendent Cathar, the deck can quickly snowball its advantage and push for a fast victory. The inclusion of removal spells like Portable Hole also helps to clear the way for attacks and maintain board control.

The deck focuses on utilizing control spells and effects to disrupt and control the opponent's game plan while setting up powerful card advantage engines and win conditions. The inclusion of Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion allows for additional value through flickering cards for repeated effects. The deck also includes a balance of removal, card draw, and disruptive creatures to maintain control of the game. The mana base is designed to provide consistent color access and utility lands for added flexibility in different matchups.

This deck focuses on aggressive play with a Dimir color combination, utilizing disruptive cards like Thoughtseize and Drown in the Loch to control the board while creatures like Thieves' Guild Enforcer and Soaring Thought-Thief chip away at the opponent's life total. The deck also includes a mix of removal spells like Fatal Push and Go for the Throat to deal with threats. With a combination of evasive creatures and disruptive spells, the deck aims to apply pressure and disrupt the opponent's game plan to secure a victory.

This Dimir Aggro deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's hand with cards like Duress and Thoughtseize while applying pressure with efficient and evasive creatures like Kaito, Malcolm, and Valki. By controlling the board with removal spells like Fatal Push and Floodpits Drowner, the deck aims to push through damage quickly and efficiently. The deck also utilizes card advantage engines like Jace Reawakened and Nashi to maintain a steady stream of threats. Mana consistency is ensured through a balanced land base including Mutavault, Watery Grave, and Darkslick Shores.

The main concept of this Boros Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with fast, aggressive creatures and burn spells. The deck focuses on dealing damage quickly and efficiently, utilizing cards like Monastery Swiftspear and Soul-Scar Mage to chip away at the opponent's life total, while also utilizing burn spells like Wizard's Lightning and Burst Lightning to finish off the opponent or take out key threats. The deck aims to maintain pressure and control the board while dealing consistent damage throughout the game.

This Rakdos Aggro deck focuses on quickly overwhelming opponents with aggressive creatures and burn spells. The deck aims to push through damage early and disrupt the opponent's game plan with cards like Thoughtseize and Duress. The inclusion of cards like Fable of the Mirror-Breaker and Blade of the Oni adds versatility to the deck, allowing for different ways to close out games quickly. With a mix of efficient removal spells and powerful threats, this deck looks to apply pressure from multiple angles to secure victory.

This deck focuses on utilizing Enigmatic Incarnation to control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy. By sacrificing creatures to tutor for powerful creatures or enchantments, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with its versatile threats. The inclusion of Atraxa, Grand Unifier and Yorion, Sky Nomad as companions adds additional value and utility to the deck. Through a combination of removal spells, efficient mana fixing, and a variety of powerful creatures with unique abilities, the deck seeks to outmaneuver and outvalue the opponent in a game of attrition.

This Dimir Control deck focuses on controlling the opponent's board through hand disruption and removal spells while utilizing cards like Narset, Parter of Veils to limit the opponent's card draw. The deck also includes Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion for additional value and Kaito, Bane of Nightmares for creature removal. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan and outvalue them using powerful control cards and finish the game with powerful threats like Sheoldred, the Apocalypse. The mana base is well-balanced to ensure consistency in casting spells.
